    Alexis Purslane

    I am a mutualist, existentialist atheist, transgender philosopher with chronic tension headaches, OCD, autism, and (probably) bipolar. I am currently getting a Bachelor’s in Computer Science with a minor in philosophy at Penn State University.

    Where to Start

    Hi there, and welcome to my blog. Right now, you might be feeling a little overwhelmed. There are a lot of posts here, with obscure titles that include phrases like “fuzzy bayesian” and “ontology,” and a lot of them are pretty long, so that’s pretty understandable. That’s why this page is here: to help you pick out which posts you should start with if you want to get a feel for the ideas I’m talking about and a taste for my style and approach to things.

    First of all, you should know that I pretty much exclusively talk about five subjects: existentialism, ethics, atheism, anarchism, and epistemology. Those are my specialties, if you will. If you’ve found my blog, I assume you’re intrested in at least one of these categories. To get you started, then, here are some of my best articles (as of the time of this writing) on each of those subjects!

    Existentialism

    For a really comprehensive introduction to my approach to existentialism, you can’t go wrong with my ‘Human Being and the World’ series, which currently has two parts.

    Ethics

    On ethics, I recommend you start out with ‘An Introduction to Anarchist Egoism’. Although it’s not as fleshed out of a defense of moral subjectivist egoism as I’d eventually like to write, it serves the purpose in the title perfectly. As a follow-up, if you want to get a look at the kind of desires I, personally, as an egoist, have for society and interactions with my fellow humans, check out ‘Anarchistic Relations’.

    Atheism

    I haven’t written very much on atheism yet, but I have actually done individual debunkings of most apologetics, in a lot of depth, addressing the best and most up-to-date versions of each of the arguments, on my YouTube channel, and I plan to turn those into articles very soon.

    Anarchism

    I definately recommend you start with ‘What Is Individualist Anarchism’, since that’s intended to be the clearest and most concise statement of my political views that I could make. ‘Anarchistic Relations’ (linked above) is also a very good article to read on this, as well as ‘Property Provisos’ and ‘Why I Am No Longer an Anarcho-Capitalist’. If you really want to dive into the deep-end, you can also check out my twenty-eight thousand word treatise on anarchism, ‘Two Principles of Anarchism’, although my views have evolved since then to a certain degree.

    Epistemology

    Unfortunately, epistemology is just going to be a very difficult subject no matter how you approach it, so although its a fairly long and dry essay, I recommend you start with ‘An Introduction to Fuzzy Pragmatist Bayesian Epistemology’, and follow up with its sequals as I write them.
